item.title: Deep Dive into WinRAR License Verification Scheme
item.description: In this post I deep dive into analyzing the license verification scheme of the popular freeware WinRAR.

item.title: A Deep Dive Into Donex Ransomware [Part 2]
item.description: [Part 2] In this series of posts we dive into the internals of the Donex Ransomware. This series serves mostly as notes to keep track of my findings. I also record the entire analysis process and upload a series of videos on my YouTube channel. More info inside the post :)

item.title: A Deep Dive into Donex Ransomware [Part 1]
item.description: [Part 1] In this series of posts we dive into the internals of the Donex Ransomware. This series serves mostly as notes to keep track of my findings. I also record the entire analysis process and upload a series of videos on my YouTube channel. More info inside the post :)

item.title: Computing Inverse Ring Homomorphisms (DIY)
item.description: In this post, I provide a detailed explanation of how to manually define the inverse ring homomorphism in SageMath, mapping a quotient ring over a finite field to a finite extension field of the same characteristic.

item.title: (Crypto) TSJ CTF 2022 - babyRSA
item.description: One of the first challenges I had solved, back in 2022. This one taught me about resultants, coppersmith’s small roots and how to work with curves defined over a ring instead of a finite field.

item.title: (Crypto) LITCTF 2023 - LCG... Squared?
item.description: This was a challenge I enjoyed solving in LITCTF 2023. I considered it a good introduction to variable elimination techniques, such as Groebner Basis and resultants.

item.title: (Crypto) Backdoor CTF 2024 - Hashing Frenzy
item.description: Hashing Frenzy was a cool challenge related to problem solving via lattice reduction techniques. My goal is to showcase some of the intuition required to translate linear equations to instances of lattice problems.
